intro: Stigmaphyllon intermedium, commonly known as the Brazilian starfruit or starfruit vine, is a climbing plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often used in local cuisine. Its leaves are palmately lobed and can be used in traditional medicine. Stigmaphyllon intermedium thrives in tropical and subtropical climates with high humidity.
